content: granny square fingerless gloves tea cake + make by nicola furey - tea cake + make any dk weight yarn and colour can be used for these cosy fingerless gloves this pattern is written in one size but is easily adjusted to suit your yarn choice and hand size sirdar haworth tweed dk 50% merino wool / 50% nylon - 50g approx 165m yarn has been used for the sample shown along with a 4mm crochet hook you will also need a pair of scissors and a wool needle to sew in your ends abbreviations + chart symbols 0 chain - chain slip_stitch - slip_stitch treble_crochet - treble_crochet double_crochet us dr - double_crochet single_crochet us space - space rs - right side bl - back loop st/s - stitch/stitches to start make 4 identical granny stitch squares using either the chart or written pattern provided you can adjust the size by either going up or down a hook size or adding or removing a round of the square you want the square to cover the palm of the hand granny square - make 4 5 foundation round - chain 4 join with a slip_stitch to form a ring 4 r1 - rs ch3 2tr into the ring *ch2 3tr into ring repeat 3 from * 2 times ch2 slip_stitch into the top of ch3 to join slip_stitch to ch2 space corner 2 1 r2 - ch3 2tr into the same corner space ch2 3tr into the same space in next and each of the other corner space 3tr ch2 3tr then slip_stitch into the top of the ch3 at the start to finish the round slip_stitch to the corner ready for the next round r3 - ch3 2tr into the same corner space ch2 3tr also in the same space then 3tr into the next space along the straight side of the square before you come to the next corner space in each corner space 3tr 2ch 3tr and on the straight side space 3tr end the round with a slip_stitch into the top of the fi r c r o 4 s v t -
